intro: Salsola rosmarinus, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is an annual or biennial herb characterized by its succulent, spine-tipped leaves and small, greenish flowers. Native to Eurasia, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The plant is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through seeds dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it both a resilient weed and a subject of ecological study.
